author: Brian Turner
method: Preheat the oven to 190C/375F/Gas 5. Grease a six-hole capacity muffin tin with some of the butter. Place the flour, butter, sugar, eggs and ricotta into a food processor and blend until combined. Place the banana into a bowl and mash with a fork. Then stir into the muffin dough mixure. Divide the mixture into six and fill the muffin tin. Transfer into the oven to bake for 12-15 minutes, until the  muffins are risen and golden and a skewer comes away clean when poked into the middle of the muffins. To serve, dust with cocoa powder.
ingredients: 110g/4oz self-raising flour,  110g/4oz butter, plus extra for greasing,  2 tbsp caster sugar,  2 free-range eggs,  3 tbsp ricotta,  1 banana, mashed with a fork,  cocoa powder for dusting
